question: Given below are the atomic masses of the elements: Li(7), Na(23), Cl(35.5), K(39), Ca(40), Br(80), Sr(88), I(127), Ba(137). Which of the following doesnâ€™t form triad?
explanation: Dobereiner's triads consist of chemically similar elements. Cl (Non-metal), K (Alkali metal), and Ca (Alkaline earth) have different properties and do not form a triad [cite: 1063-1065].
